turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm so frustrated! We've had three AR denials this week with reason code CO-45 - 'Charges exceed our fee schedule'. We've billed the standard rate for these procedures for years! What's going on?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let's investigate those denials. CO-45 indicates the billed amount exceeds the payer's allowed amount. To help me pinpoint the issue, can you provide the CPT codes and billed amounts for those three denials? Also, the payer name would be helpful.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, one was CPT 99214 billed at $150 to Blue Cross. Another was 73560 billed at $85 to United Healthcare. And the last one was 29505 billed at $60, also to Blue Cross. Are they suddenly changing their fee schedules without notice?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. I've checked the fee schedules for Blue Cross and United Healthcare for those CPT codes. It appears there were no recent changes communicated directly. However, I did notice that for CPT code 99214 to Blue Cross, the contracted rate we have on file is $135. For 73560 to United Healthcare, the contracted rate is $75, and for 29505 to Blue Cross, it's $55. It seems your office is billing above the contracted rates for those specific services. Are you perhaps using an outdated fee schedule in your billing system?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Oh wow! That makes sense. Our billing software probably hasn't been updated with the latest contracted rates. I'll have our IT department check that right away. Thanks! That was actually really helpful. I wish I had checked this sooner!
